thread.title: UP panchayat poll: 12 injured in clash
thread.title_full: UP panchayat poll: 12 injured in clash

author: tribuneindia.com
title: UP panchayat poll: 12 injured in clash
text:
Muzaffarnagar, October 10
At least 12 persons, including a police constable and a Home Guard jawan, were injured in a clash between two groups in Manet village here during the first phase of polling for panchayats, the police said.
The incident occurred yesterday when some people confronted an alleged fake voter at a polling booth in the village following which the situation turned violent, they said.
The argument snowballed into a group clash and stone-pelting which left police constable Nishant, Home Guard jawan Ishver Singh, and 10 others injured, the police said.
A case has been registered and six persons arrested in this connection, they said.
All the injured persons have been shifted to a hospital.
Villagers boycott election Meanwhile, the residents of Deopura village in Shamli district have boycotted the panchayat election as polling booth was not established for them in their village.
The village was supposed to cast its vote yesterday in the first phase of the ongoing panchayat elections in the state.
Additional District Magistrate Bharat Pandit said the district authorities tried to persuade the villagers to take part in the voting but to no avail.
The villagers refused to go to the polling booth that was established, as it has been done in the past in the neighbouring village of Jagdishpur, saying it was too far. â€” PTI
